panels.description:
Visual breakdown of Zeebe namespace health status.
Each slice represents the count of namespaces that are:

Healthy: All associated pods report health status = 1

Unhealthy: At least one associated pod reports health status < 1

This chart helps quickly assess the overall health distribution across all monitored namespaces.

targets.expr: count(avg(zeebe_health{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace"}) by (namespace) == 1)
count(avg(zeebe_health{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace"}) by (namespace) < 1)

panels.title: Engine Health Overview

panels.description:
Displays a list of Zeebe namespaces with an average health score below 1, indicating partial or complete service degradation.

Each row shows:

The namespace

Its corresponding average health value

Use this table to quickly identify which namespaces require attention due to unhealthy task workers or degraded pods.

targets.expr: count(zeebe_health{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace"}) by (namespace)

panels.title: Unhealthy Zeebe Namespaces

panels.description:
Shows the proportion of pods that are fully available vs partially available over the past 15 minutes.

Available: Pods with 100% readiness

Unavailable: Pods that were not fully ready during this window

Use this chart to quickly assess cluster-level pod health and spot degraded workloads.

targets.expr:
count by (status) (
  label_replace(
    avg by (pod) (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{camunda_region=~"$region", container!~"curator|curl", namespace=~"$namespace"}[15m])
    ) == 1,
    "status",
    "Available",
    "",
    ""
  )
)

count by (status) (
  label_replace(
    avg by (pod) (
      avg_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{camunda_region=~"$region", container!~"curator|curl", namespace=~"$namespace"}[15m])
    ) < 1,
    "status",
    "Unavailable",
    "",
    ""
  )
)

panels.title: Pod Availability Distribution

panels.description:
Lists pods with less than 100% readiness over the past 15 minutes, indicating possible instability or restarts.

Each row shows:

The pod name

Its average readiness (from kube_pod_container_status_ready)

Only pods with availability < 1 are shown. Use this to monitor degraded pod availability across your region or cluster.
panels.title: Pods with Partial Availability

panels.description:
Displays the top 10 namespaces with the highest average disk usage across Zeebe-related PVCs.
Disk usage is calculated as:

used_bytes / capacity_bytes

This helps you quickly identify namespaces approaching PVC storage limits, indicating potential need for cleanup or volume resizing.
panels.title: Top 10 Namespaces by PVC Disk Usage

panels.description:
Lists namespaces where average Zeebe PVC disk usage exceeds 80%.
Disk usage is calculated as:

used_bytes / capacity_bytes

These namespaces may be at risk of running out of disk space and require investigation or intervention.
panels.title: Namespaces with High PVC Disk Usage

panels.description: Displays average partition processing rate (records/sec) per namespace. Helps identify the most active namespaces by throughput.

targets.expr: topk(10, avg by (namespace) (sum(rate(zeebe_stream_processor_records_total{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", action=~"skipped|processed"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace, pod, partition, processor)))

panels.title: Top Namespaces by processing rate

panels.description:
Shows the standard deviation of Zeebe processing rates across partitions for each namespace.
Higher values indicate uneven workload distribution across pods or partitions, which may signal routing issues, backpressure, or hot partitions.

Use this table to identify imbalanced namespaces where load is not spread evenly, potentially impacting performance or reliability.

targets.expr: sum(rate(zeebe_stream_processor_records_total{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", action=~"processed"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace, pod, partition, processor)

panels.title: Partition Load Imbalance by Namespace

panels.description: Shows the current processed records

targets.expr: sum(rate(zeebe_element_instance_events_total{namespace=~"$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (type, action, eventType)

panels.title: Current Events

panels.description: Displays the top namespaces with the highest percentage of dropped Zeebe requests over total received requests. Calculated using the rate of dropped requests divided by the rate of received requests, multiplied by 100. Filtered by selected cluster(s) and namespace(s), over the chosen time interval.

targets.expr: topk(10, (sum(rate(zeebe_dropped_request_count_total{namespace=~"$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace) / sum(rate(zeebe_received_request_count_total{namespace=~"$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace) ) * 100)

panels.title: Top Namespace by Backpressure Dropped Requests

panels.description: Shows the top namespaces with the highest percentage of dropped Zeebe requests. The percentage is calculated as the rate of dropped requests divided by the rate of received requests, multiplied by 100. Results are filtered by the selected cluster(s) and namespace(s), and aggregated over the configured rate interval.

targets.expr: topk(10, (sum(rate(zeebe_dropped_request_count_total{namespace=~"$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace) / sum(rate(zeebe_received_request_count_total{namespace=~"$namespace"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace) ) * 100)

panels.title: Top Namespace by Backpressure Dropped Requests

panels.description: Total number of gRPC calls handled per second, grouped by method. Useful for monitoring overall traffic volume and per-method activity.

targets.expr: sum by(method) (rate(grpc_server_processing_duration_seconds_count{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", method=~"$method"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Request Rate gRPC

panels.description: Total number of gRPC calls handled per second, grouped by method. Useful for monitoring overall traffic volume and per-method activity.
panels.title: Request Rate gRPC (top 10)

panels.description: Shows high-percentile latency per gRPC method over the selected range, excluding the ActivateJobs method.
panels.title: p95 Latency gRPC

panels.description: Shows high-percentile latency per gRPC method over the selected range, excluding the ActivateJobs method.
panels.title: p95 Latency gRPC (top 10)

panels.description: Fraction of gRPC requests resulting in INTERNAL errors per method. High values may indicate server-side issues or crashes.

targets.expr: sum by(method) (rate(grpc_server_processing_duration_seconds_count{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", method=~"$method", grpc_code="INTERNAL"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(method) (rate(grpc_server_processing_duration_seconds_count{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", method=~"$method"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Error Rate gRPC

panels.description: Fraction of gRPC requests resulting in errors per method. High values may indicate server-side issues or crashes.
panels.title: Error Rate gRPC (top 10)

panels.description: Raw increase of latency bucket counts over time for all methods excluding ActivateJobs. Useful for histogram exploration and debugging tail latencies.

targets.expr: sum(increase(grpc_server_processing_duration_seconds_bucket{camunda_region=~"$region", namespace=~"$namespace", method=~"$method", method!~"ActivateJobs"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le)

panels.title: Latency Heatmap gRPC

panels.description: Highest-requested API endpoints based on request rate, excluding internal /actuator and Prometheus paths.

panels.description: Endpoints with the highest average request duration, excluding known internal and noisy paths.

panels.description: Endpoints with the highest average request duration, excluding known internal and noisy paths.
panels.title: Average Latency REST (top 10)

panels.description: Endpoints with the highest proportion of server-side errors (5xx), useful for spotting failing API routes.

panels.description: Endpoints with the highest proportion of server-side errors (5xx), useful for spotting failing API routes.

panels.description: Endpoints with the highest proportion of server-side errors (4xx).
panels.title: Client error rate REST (top 10)

targets.expr: count by(alertname) (ALERTS{team=~"operate|tasklist|optimize|zeebe", label_cloud_camunda_io_sales_plan_type!="trial", alertstate="firing", namespace=~"$namespace"})
